H0.text: A cloud is a medium through which sound waves cannot travel.

H1.text: A vacuum is a medium that sound waves cannot travel through.

H2.text: Metal is a material through which sound waves are not able to travel.

H3.text: Water is the medium through which sound waves are not able to travel.

A4.text: Sound cannot travel through a vacuum.

A5.text: The mechanical vibrations that can be interpreted as sound can travel through all forms of matter: gases, liquids, solids, and plasmas.
